resources.string: You can ADD, DELETE, MOVE, SEARCH, BACKUP, RESTORE and RESET your custom command item. You can also long click on the item label to EDIT the item.
Put your own command string here, it will be run in Android environment to get the output displayed.
Put your desired delimiter string if you want to split the output into lines, default is "\\n".
To get the output upon the fragment is created, check this option. Otherwise you have to click RUN button manually to get the output.
The Powersploit payload provides you a choice of reverse meterpreter HTTP/S payloads. "URL to payload" should be a URL accessible to the victim machine where the larger payload is downloaded to.
This Windows CMD payload allows you to enter raw commands to a Windows command prompt. Hitting the list menu will allow you to choose keyboard layout or UAC bypass options.

Kali Chroot services can be started and stopped via the switch toggle buttons, you can also ADD, DELETE, MOVE, SEARCH, BACKUP, RESTORE and RESET your own service item, and long click on the item label to EDIT the item as well.

To START a service in kali, a command will be run INSIDE KaliChroot that looks like this:

busybox chroot <chroot_folder> /usr/bin/sudo <command_to_start_service>

Service is considered STARTED if the return value is 0 and vice versa.

To STOP a service in kali, a command will be run INSIDE KaliChroot that looks like this:

busybox chroot <chroot_folder> /usr/bin/sudo <command_to_stop_service>

Service is considered STOPPED if the return value is 0 and vice versa.

To Check if a service in kali is up or not, a command will be run OUTSIDE KaliChroot that looks like this:

busybox ps -o pid,comm | grep -w '<service_name>'

Service is considered UP if the return value is 0 and vice versa.
To automatically start the service after Kali Chroot is up, check this option.
Load drivers, if you have any enabled as modules. Most devices use all drivers as inbuilt. Alpha version.
You can ADD, DELETE, MOVE, SEARCH, BACKUP, RESTORE and RESET your custom command item. You can also long click on the item label to EDIT the item.
No USB function is currently enabled
Image Mounter can be used only if the USB function \"mass_storage\" has been enabled
USB NetWork Tethering can be used only if the USB function \"rndis\" or \"acmecm\" has been enabled

This is our implementation of the BadUSB attack as demonstrated at Black Hat USA 2014. Enabling this USB gadget mode will allow your device to act as a USB network interface when plugged into a target computer. Connecting the USB cable to a PC will force all traffic from that PC (Windows or Linux) through the NetHunter device, where the traffic can be MITM\'ed.

Start an Evil-Twin Access Point and intercept HTTP traffic. Custom captive portals, featuring mobile network upstream (rmnet_data2), internal wlan0 upstream, internal wlan0/wlan1 AP mode, and external adapters. Custom portals are also supported. Testing version. Preview will be added soon.
The hostapd configuration file used for 802.1x/EAP authentication attack (hostapd-wpe) This is not used with MANA.
The dhcpd configuration file used by Mana.
The dnsspoof configuration file used by Mana.
The Mana script that does full NAT & SSL interception.
The Mana script that does full NAT only.
The Mana script that does full NAT & BDFProxy HTTP routing to port 8080.
Route traffic to bettercap proxy with Mana-toolkit

The DuckHunter script can easily convert "USB Rubber Ducky" scripts into NetHunter HID format. You can generate preconfigured scripts at the incredibly useful Ducky Toolkit site, or check out the Rubber Ducky script syntax from the official README
NetHunter App does not have permission to send to NetHunter terminal!
Error launching intent. Install Android Terminal!

**Important: Android 10 has MAC Randomization provided already, but if you still want to set a custom mac address yourself, the following criteria are required:
1. Enable the 'Use randomised MAC' on each SSID you connect to.
2. The AP you want to connect to must be connected with a correct password before.
As Manually connect to a AP will lose the changed mac.
Uh oh! NetHunter can\'t find busybox!

string-array.name: interface_opts
string-array.item: usb0 (USB > Ethernet Nexus7 2013 when tethering | badusb)

resources.string: Welcome to the Kali NetHunter Desktop Experience.\nEnjoy the full potential of Kali Linux, straight from your pocket, even on HDMI output. Audio supported, Use the Audio Manager to stream sound through KeX. Delay has been added to avoid soft reboot on some devices.
Welcome to Bluetooth Arsenal! Internal bluetooth support is now available for devices with RFCOMM, UART H4, VHCI and BINDER_IPC enabled in kernel, or devices with bt_smd driver.

Carwhisperer script from the way back. Listen to, or inject audio to various devices like speakers, headsets, watches or even cars. Carwshisperer is not supported by internal bluetooth (VHCI or bt_smd) yet.
Spoof your BT adapters address, class, and name.
Brute force BT device addresses, ping, and discover their services.

Inspired by the Mr.Robot police car scene and the Flipper XFW Team, you can now create a Bluetooth keyboard server and send keystrokes straight from NetHunter. You may need to run setup again from the top right menu to install BadBT. Running this on a smartwatch against your paired phone may despair your watch from phone/wearos app. Prefixes are experimental.

Social Engineering Toolkit email template builder by yesimxev. Please note you need to have a working Gmail or email relay configuration for SET in order to use these templates. It is recommended not to have account picture if you use Gmail.
OneShot performs WPS PIN and Pixie Dust attack without having to switch to monitor mode. Note that if scan is empty, you might need to reset your interface.

Select your desired boot animation here. Please note that some older phones prefer 90% the size of original screen resolution, so it can run smoothly. In that case, tick convert, then set image resolution and final resolution together.

Flash your custom kernel straight from Android. Still in experimental state. Some systems does not support runtime flashing. In that case, it is recommended to flash the kernel through recovery. Your device\'s actual codename may not be in the kernel repo, in that case, use the list below to find available device names.
An existing Kali chroot directory was found!
No Kali chroot directory was found.

There\'s no going back. You lose everything in your chroot. Forever-ever.\n\nNOTE: To fully ensure the chroot is not mounted and no processes are using it, THE DEVICE WILL NOW BE REBOOTED, then the chroot will be deleted.
The device is being restarted. (No complaining. You were just told this would happen!)
Deleting to make room for download…
Problem deleting old file. Just sayin\'.
Nowhere to write to. Make sure you have your external storage mounted and available.
Kali chroot is mounted and NOT deleted. Reboot again to remove!!
Something went wrong verifying the downloaded file. Whoops. Try again.

This is Chroot Manager for Kali. The \"chroot\" is a full installation of Kali Linux that shares processing, networking, storage, and other resources with Android. It resides in your internal app storage area and is required to have at least 8 Gb free space for the minimal or full installation, just to make sure it won\'t break your system.

WARNING:\nNetHunter installs and uses a standard Kali Linux distribution \"under the hood\". To support this functionality, some standard Android security features such as Security Enhanced Linux (SELinux) are disabled. Moreover, Kali\'s Linux processes may run with full root privileges and can therefore access system functionality well beyond the normal Android security model. Consider therefore that this device, as a hybrid, may not be as secure as either standard Kali Linux OR standard Android, and you are advised not to install or use Nethunter on \"daily driver\" devices or devices which store or access sensitive/private data.

LICENSE INFO:\nNetHunter is licensed under the GPLv2 (gnu.org/licenses/old-licenses/gpl-2.0.en.html) and the source code is available at gitlab.com/kalilinux/nethunter.\n Some icons are licensed from Google, Inc. under CC BY 4.0 (creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0). Android-VersionManager and jTar are licensed under Apache 2.0.

Choose some "metapackages". The chroot will also be upgraded (via "apt-get update/dist-upgrade").

Selecting metapackages you already have installed (or no packages at all) simply update/upgrades without removing anything.

Depending on what metapackages you select, you may be asked to do stuff (such as set passwords for services), so pay attention.
Local storage requirements may be in the 20+ GB range. This installation/update will be performed in a terminal, so watch for issues. When completed, press the back button.

Whoopsy daisy! NetHunter requires elevated administrator (root) privileges.

Make sure root access is available.

If you touched the deny button by error, go to SuperSU app, find NetHunter in the APPS tab, and allow access (grant).

Depending on your version of Android, this may require a "rooting" procedure to install the su binary.

On LineageOS or LS-based Android, you may need to go to your device Settings, and under Developer Options, enable Root access for Apps.

Additionally, you will need to make sure busybox is installed, usually to /system/xbin/busybox.

You appear to already have an existing Kali chroot from an older version of Nethunter.

Migrating it to its new location requires a reboot.

 Or, you can leave the old chroot alone and install a new chroot. If you choose this option, make sure you have enough storage for both.

MSFvenom Payload Creator (MSFPC) is a wrapper written by g0tmi1k to generate multiple types of payloads, based on users choice. The idea is to be as simple as possible (only requiring one input) to produce their payload.
Decompressing and deploying the Chroot… (~5–10 min)
Enable OS version detect, script scan, and traceroute
The pineapple connector is used in conjunction with the Hak5 Pineapple Nano and a USB OTG cable. This helper will connect the Pineapple Nano over ethernet and upstream your wifi connection.

Converts your GPS to NMEA then provides to Kali chroot. Perfect for wardriving with Kismet or just a generic GPS server for Kali. Select your desired datasources. Make sure your wireless interface is in monitor mode before starting Kismet. Internal wireless interfaces can also be used thanks to the monitor mode by QCACLD-3.0 driver.
You may need to give Nethunter permissions to GPS. Go to Settings > Apps > Nethunter > Permissions.
Notification for run at boot services

Long press to manage a command, dont forget to backup!. Use double quotes if needed.
This module allow Chroot audio playback to Android environment over local server, ensuring seamless playback of HQ-Audio output through the main speakers.
Module Based on PulseDroid by dront78
